channel.title: GDACS RSS information
channel.description: Near real-time alerts about natural disaster with a potential humanitarian impact

item.title: Green earthquake alert (Magnitude 5.5M, Depth:10km) in Tonga 20/05/2018 00:42 UTC, Few people within 100km.
item.description: On 5/20/2018 12:42:14 AM, an earthquake occurred in Tonga potentially affecting Few people within 100km. The earthquake had Magnitude 5.5M, Depth:10km.

item.title: Green alert for tropical cyclone SAGAR-18. Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.description: From 16/05/2018 to 19/05/2018, a Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 102 km/h) SAGAR-18 was active in NorthIndian. The cyclone affects these countries: Somalia, Ethiopia, Yemen (vulnerability High). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.
item.dc:subject: TC1
item.gdacs:severity: Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 93 km/h)
item.gdacs:population: Population affected by Category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Tropical cyclones potential rainfall (NOAA/NESDIS)
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: Website dedicated to the rainfall estimation associated with tropical cyclones

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: OCHA Situation Reports for Tropical Cyclones
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: List of most recent OCHA situation reports published on ReliefWeb

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Overview map
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The image of Cyclone
gdacs:resource.gdacs:acknowledgements: Copyright European Union. Syndication allowed, provided the source is acknowledged.

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.
gdacs:resource.gdacs:acknowledgements: Copyright European Union. Syndication allowed, provided the source is acknowledged.

gdacs:resource.gdacs:title: Extreme rainfall (original)
gdacs:resource.gdacs:description: The original map shows the accumulated precipitation along the cyclone's track. Yellow area is > 100mm; Red area is > 300mm; Blue area is > 500mm. The accumulated rainfall is calculated based on the Tropical Rainfall Potential of NOAA/NESDIS. The eTRaP is a simple ensemble whose members are the 6-hourly totals from the single-orbit TRaPs, which are rainfall estimates from passive microwave remote sensing.

item.title: Green flood alert in South Sudan
item.description: On 13/05/2018, a flood started in South Sudan, lasting until 17/05/2018 (last update). The flood caused 0 killed and 2000 displaced .
item.dc:subject: FL1

item.title: Volcanic eruption is on going for Kilauea in United States
